property.name: cluster.name
property.description: A cluster-based name for CDAP. It is used for scope resolution of preferences and runtime arguments. For example: the preference key "cluster.[cluster.name].my.key" would be resolved to "my.key" at runtime; a program can then retrieve the preference value by using just "my.key". The administrator can use this property to set different preferences for each cluster.

property.name: hdfs.lib.dir

property.name: hdfs.namespace
property.description: Root directory for HDFS files written by CDAP

property.description: User name for accessing HDFS

property.name: instance.name
property.description: Determines a unique identifier for a CDAP instance. It is used for providing authorization to a particular CDAP instance. Must be alphanumeric, and should not be changed after CDAP has been started. If it is changed, there is a risk of losing data (for example, authorization policies).

property.name: local.data.dir
property.description: Data directory for Standalone CDAP and the CDAP Master process in Distributed CDAP

property.name: mapreduce.include.custom.format.classes

property.name: mapreduce.jobclient.connect.max.retries
property.description: Indicates the maximum number of retries the JobClient will make to establish a service connection when retrieving job status and history

property.name: master.manage.hbase.coprocessors
property.description: Whether CDAP Master should manage HBase coprocessors. This should only be set to false if you are managing coprocessors yourself in order to support rolling HBase upgrades.

property.name: master.startup.checks.classes
property.description: Comma-separated list of classnames for checks that will be run before the CDAP Master starts up. If any of the checks fails, the CDAP Master will not start up. Checks will only be run if ${master.startup.checks.enabled} is set to true.

property.name: master.startup.checks.enabled
property.description: Whether checks should be run before startup to determine if the CDAP Master can be run correctly. Which checks are run is determined by the ${master.startup.checks.packages} and ${master.startup.checks.classes} settings. If any checks fail, the CDAP Master will fail to start instead of waiting for the problem to be fixed. This setting only affects Distributed CDAP. It does not apply to Standalone CDAP.

property.name: master.startup.checks.packages
property.description: Comma-separated list of packages containing checks that will be run before the CDAP Master starts up. If any of the checks fails, the CDAP Master will not start up. Checks will only be run if ${master.startup.checks.enabled} is set to true.

property.name: namespaces.dir

security.authorization.admin.users
property.description: A comma-separated list of users for whom admin privileges are to be granted on the CDAP instance during CDAP startup, so that these users can create namespaces. These users are also granted admin privileges on the 'default' namespace, so that they can manage privileges on the 'default' namespace. This provides a method to bootstrap CDAP on an authorization-enabled cluster. The default value is empty, in which case no users have access to creating namespaces or to managing privileges on the 'default' namespace. In that scenario, authorization in CDAP has to be bootstrapped externally using interfaces provided by the configured authorization extension.

property.name: security.authorization.cache.enabled
property.description: Determines if authorization policies can be cached by programs; defaults to true

property.name: security.authorization.cache.refresh.interval.secs
property.description: The interval in seconds after which a background thread will refresh cached authorization policies. It is recommended to keep this value slightly lower than ${security.authorization.cache.ttl.secs}, so that the cached authorization policies do not expire unless they have been explicitly revoked. This setting only takes effect if ${security.authorization.cache.enabled} is set to true.

property.name: security.authorization.cache.ttl.secs
property.description: The time-to-live in seconds for entries in the authorization cache used by programs. This setting only takes effect if ${security.authorization.cache.enabled} is set to true.

property.name: security.authorization.enabled
security.authorization.extension.jar.path
property.description: If an external authorization system is used for authorizing operations on CDAP entities, this property sets the path to the bundled JAR file containing the extension code. This jar is only used when authorization is enabled by setting ${security.authorization.enabled} to true.
